column5: Check out Birch Dale Lodge www.birchdalelodge.com they have a great family plan.

Gotta give Young's Wilderness Camp a resounding "check them out"! They have two very very nice housekeeping cabins. One will sleep up to 6, the other 8 and both cabins are virtually brand new! We are always there at the end of May, first of June and almost always at least one is in use for housekeeping! Excellent boats, excellent separate big dock for housekeeping, excellent fishing!!
We're an American Plan place at least 95% anyways... there's some awesome House Keeping operations all over Ontario though!

Thanks for all the info. Im looking at birchdale lodge on eagle lake thanks narda1. I talked to cheryl last nite shes at the greenbay wi. show. Im looking to go in july or aug. She had nice things to say about you. Now i just need the wifes okay. (ANY OTHER CAMPS WITH A GOOD FAMILTY PLAN) thanks steve
I go to Birchdale every year and love the place, Cheryl and Marcel will take excellent care of you.

Ghost River Lodges is a boat in about 3 hours North of I Falls. Have both American Plan and Housekeeping. Several different lakes to fish with fantastic Walleye fishing. Cabins, boats, motors all good.
Birchdale gets my vote,Always a great time there!
Thanks for all the help and info everyone gave me. I think i made my choice to be birchdale lodge on eagle lake. The price is rite & its what im looking for in my family vacation. Thanks STEVE

Looking for a drive in or boat in. With a good family package for me & wife and 15yr old daughter. Housekeeping with good boats & cabins & most of all great fishing. North of international falls. Thanks for any info STEVE

sunset lodge, five lakes lodge, poplar point ,jsut to name a couple up here on the red lake chain of lakes check out the area maybe its waht ya need and the town of red klake isnt far from any camp so ya can go shopping etc have a good 1 harry spence

Mylie's Place - www.myliesplaceresort.com Buena Vista - www.buenavistaresort.com Young's Wilderness - www.youngswildernesscamp.com (I believe they only do housekeeping in July/August/September, but I'm not 100% sure)

You might give Lac Seul Lodge a look. The cabins are very nice. Good boats and motors and very good fishing within sight of the lodge or you can go exploring for miles and miles. The lodge is close to Ear Falls if you need groceries, beer, bait, or feel like going out to dinner. I have been going for over ten years and can't wait til June gets here so I can go again. We started going when my son was four years old. He will start college next Fall so who knows what his schedule will allow in the future but we are going up at least twice this summer. I think you would enjoy the experience.
We don't wanna forget Obabikon - http://www.obabikon.com/ or maybe he's booked up.
try www.lacseul.comAndrea has smaller cabins, and boat-upgrades available. Ear Falls is just a few miles away if you need some shopping. Better hurry, this time of year things can fill up fast!
Check out Vermilion Bay lodge on Eagle Lake.www.vermilionbaylodge.com
Spruce Island Camp on lake of the woods, remote about an hour boat ride from Morson, all the comforts of home. Good fishing and not a lot of boat traffic. Staff has always been good to us.
Thanks for for the info. I will look at all of the lodges.
